item.title: Practical Developer Productivity
item.description: Practical Developer Productivity Developer productivity has been studied extensively across the last few decades because developers are typically the most expensive piece of software development. Despite decades of research, nobody has cracked the case. Moreover, most teams struggle to come up with a metric or goal to even define what it means to capture “developer productivity.” Over the last few months, I’ve spent a significant amount of energy in the space of developer productivity for an organization of ~500 developers.
